translated: The question about passing on from one body to another

original: “bhante nāgasena, atthi koci satto yo imamhā kāyā aññaṁ kāyaṁ saṅkamatī”ti?
analyzed: bhante nāgasena atthi koci satto yaḥ imamhā kāyā aññam kāyam saṅkamati iti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, is there any being who passes on from this body to another body?”

original: “Yadi, bhante nāgasena, imamhā kāyā aññaṁ kāyaṁ saṅkamanto natthi, nanu mutto bhavissati pāpakehi kammehī”ti?
analyzed: yadi bhante nāgasena imamhā kāyā aññam kāyam saṅkamantaḥ natthi nanu muttaḥ bhavissati pāpakehi kammehi iti
translated: “If, revered Nāgasena, there is no passing on from this body to another body, is not a man free from evil deeds?”

original: “Āma, mahārāja, yadi na paṭisandaheyya, mutto bhavissati pāpakehi kammehīti, yasmā ca kho, mahārāja, paṭisandahati, tasmā na parimutto pāpakehi kammehī”ti.
analyzed: āma mahā rāja yadi na paṭisandaheyya muttaḥ bhavissati pāpakehi kammehi iti yasmā ca kho mahā rāja paṭisandahati tasmā na parimuttaḥ pāpakehi kammehi iti
translated: “Yes, sire, if he does not take rebirth he is free from evil deeds, but because he does take rebirth, sire, he is not free from evil deeds.”

original: “Yathā, mahārāja, kocideva puriso aññatarassa purisassa ambaṁ avahareyya, kiṁ so daṇḍappatto bhaveyyā”ti?
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja kocid eva purisaḥ aññatarassa purisassa ambam avahareyya kim saḥ daṇḍa ppattaḥ bhaveyya ati
translated: “Suppose, sire, some man were to steal a mango from another man, would he be liable to punishment?”

analyzed: āma bhante daṇḍa ppattaḥ bhaveyya ati
translated: “Yes, revered sir, he would be liable to punishment.”

original: “Na kho so, mahārāja, tāni ambāni avahari, yāni tena ropitāni, kasmā daṇḍappatto bhaveyyā”ti?
analyzed: na kho saḥ mahā rāja tāni ambāni avahari yāni tena ropitāni kasmai daṇḍa ppattaḥ bhaveyya ati
translated: “But, sire, he did not steal the mangoes that had been planted by that man, so why should he be liable to punishment?”

original: “Tāni, bhante, ambāni nissāya jātāni, tasmā daṇḍappatto bhaveyyā”ti.
analyzed: tāni bhante ambāni nissāya jātāni tasmā daṇḍa ppattaḥ bhaveyya ati
translated: “Because they grew from those mangoes, Sir, he would be liable to punishment.”

original: “Evameva kho, mahārāja, iminā nāmarūpena kammaṁ karoti sobhanaṁ vā asobhanaṁ vā, tena kammena aññaṁ nāmarūpaṁ paṭisandahati, tasmā na parimutto pāpakehi kammehī”ti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja iminā nāma rūpena kammam karoti sobhanam vā asobhanam vā tena kammena aññam nāma rūpam paṭisandahati tasmā na parimuttaḥ pāpakehi kammehi iti
translated: “In the same way, sire, one performs a good or bad action through this mind and matter and by that action one generates another mind and matter, and therefore one is not free from evil actions.”
